name: Pork Chop Casserole
author: lisascooking
summary: My mom always made this in the fall months when the weather turned colder. My family loves it. Very easy Sunday dinner.
ingredients: 6  Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and quartered
1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Put pork chops into a roasting pan
Arrange potatoes, onions, and carrots around the chops
Sprinkle onion soup mix over the chops and vegetables; season with salt and black pepper
Pour beef broth over the entire mixture
Place a cover on the roasting pan and bake in the preheated oven until the pork chops are no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
